questions.question: What are the steps to install ComfyUI-TacoNodes?
questions.answer: 1. Navigate to your ComfyUI installation location and find the `custom_nodes` folder. 2. While inside the `custom_nodes` folder, run the following command: `git clone https://github.com/YOUR-WORST-TACO/ComfyUI-TacoNodes.git` 3. Restart ComfyUI to see the new nodes located under `Taco_Nodes`.
questions.subject: ComfyUI-TacoNodes

questions.question: What future goals does the author of ComfyUI-TacoNodes have in mind?
questions.answer: The author plans to allow the Taco Animated Image Loader to provide a mask output, create a method to inherit latent data from a previous latent, possibly refactor how the Taco Latent Image options are formatted, and add any other node they may need in the future.
questions.subject: ComfyUI-TacoNodes

questions.question: What is the purpose of the Taco Latent Image node?
questions.answer: The Taco Latent Image node simplifies workflow tweaking in ComfyUI by allowing users to select an aspect ratio and a scale for that ratio, providing faster latent image creation.
questions.subject: Taco Latent Image

questions.question: What aspect ratios and resolutions are available in the Taco Latent Image node?
questions.answer: The following aspect ratios and their corresponding resolutions are available: 1:1 - 512 x 512, 3:4 - 416 x 576, 4:3 - 576 x 416, 9:16 - 384 x 672, 16:9 - 672 x 384.
questions.subject: Taco Latent Image

questions.question: What is the Taco Animated Image Loader used for?
questions.answer: The Taco Animated Image Loader is used to input an animated image and break it up into a batch of the individual frames.
questions.subject: Taco Animated Image Loader

questions.question: What is the Taco Gif Maker used for?
questions.answer: The Taco Gif Maker is used to combine a collection of images into a gif.
questions.subject: Taco Gif Maker

questions.question: What is the primary difference between the Taco Img2Img Animated Loader and the Taco Img2Img Animated Processor?
questions.answer: The Taco Img2Img Animated Loader takes a single image and generates a batch of images to be processed for gif creation, while the Taco Img2Img Animated Processor takes an existing image Tensor and batches it by frames for further processing.
questions.subject: Taco Img2Img Animated Loader, Taco Img2Img Animated Processor
